metadata.description: Generate high quality, realistic music with fine controls using Elevenlabs Music!

info.title: Queue OpenAPI for fal-ai/elevenlabs/music
info.description: The OpenAPI schema for the fal-ai/elevenlabs/music queue.

ElevenlabsMusicInput.description: Request format for Elevenlabs Music API

prompt.description: The text prompt describing the music to generate
prompt.title: Prompt
examples: Mysterious original soundtrack, themes of jungle, rainforest, nature, woodwinds, busy rhythmic tribal percussion.

composition_plan.description: The composition plan for the music

music_length_ms.description: The length of the song to generate in milliseconds. Used only in conjunction with prompt. Must be between 3000ms and 600000ms. Optional - if not provided, the model will choose a length based on the prompt.
music_length_ms.title: Music Length Ms

output_format.description: Output format of the generated audio. Formatted as codec_sample_rate_bitrate. So an mp3 with 22.05kHz sample rate at 32kbs is represented as mp3_22050_32. MP3 with 192kbps bitrate requires you to be subscribed to Creator tier or above. PCM with 44.1kHz sample rate requires you to be subscribed to Pro tier or above. Note that the Î¼-law format (sometimes written mu-law, often approximated as u-law) is commonly used for Twilio audio inputs.
output_format.title: Output Format

respect_sections_durations.description: Controls how strictly section durations in the composition_plan are enforced. It will only have an effect if it is used with composition_plan. When set to true, the model will precisely respect each section's duration_ms from the plan. When set to false, the model may adjust individual section durations which will generally lead to better generation quality and improved latency, while always preserving the total song duration from the plan.
respect_sections_durations.title: Respect Sections Durations

force_instrumental.description: If true, guarantees that the generated song will be instrumental. If false, the song may or may not be instrumental depending on the prompt. Can only be used with prompt.
force_instrumental.title: Force Instrumental

ElevenlabsMusicInput.title: MusicRequest

audio.description: The generated music audio file in MP3 format

negative_global_styles.description: The styles that should not be present in the entire song.
negative_global_styles.title: Negative Global Styles

positive_global_styles.description: The styles that should be present in the entire song.
positive_global_styles.title: Positive Global Styles

file_size.description: The size of the file in bytes.
file_size.title: File Size

file_name.description: The name of the file. It will be auto-generated if not provided.
file_name.title: File Name

content_type.description: The mime type of the file.
content_type.title: Content Type

url.description: The URL where the file can be downloaded from.
url.title: Url

positive_local_styles.description: The styles that should be present in this section.
positive_local_styles.title: Positive Local Styles

lines.description: The lyrics of the section. Each line must be at most 200 characters long.
lines.title: Lines

negative_local_styles.description: The styles that should not be present in this section.
negative_local_styles.title: Negative Local Styles

duration_ms.title: Duration Ms
duration_ms.description: The duration of the section in milliseconds. Must be between 3000ms and 120000ms.

section_name.description: The name of the section. Must be between 1 and 100 characters.
section_name.title: Section Name

schema.description: Whether to include logs (`1`) in the response or not (`0`).

success.description: Whether the request was cancelled successfully.

metadata.description: Generate realistic audio dialogues using Eleven-v3 from ElevenLabs.

info.title: Queue OpenAPI for fal-ai/elevenlabs/text-to-dialogue/eleven-v3
info.description: The OpenAPI schema for the fal-ai/elevenlabs/text-to-dialogue/eleven-v3 queue.

stability.description: Determines how stable the voice is and the randomness between each generation. Lower values introduce broader emotional range for the voice. Higher values can result in a monotonous voice with limited emotion. Must be one of 0.0, 0.5, 1.0, else it will be rounded to the nearest value.
stability.title: Stability

examples.text: [applause] Thank you all for coming tonight! Today we have a very special guest with us.
[gulps] ... [strong canadian accent] [excited] Hello everyone! Thank you all for having me tonight on this special day.

inputs.description: A list of dialogue inputs, each containing text and a voice ID which will be converted into speech.
inputs.title: Inputs

language_code.description: Language code (ISO 639-1) used to enforce a language for the model. An error will be returned if language code is not supported by the model.
language_code.title: Language Code

use_speaker_boost.description: This setting boosts the similarity to the original speaker. Using this setting requires a slightly higher computational load, which in turn increases latency.
use_speaker_boost.title: Use Speaker Boost

pronunciation_dictionary_locators.description: A list of pronunciation dictionary locators (id, version_id) to be applied to the text. They will be applied in order. You may have up to 3 locators per request
pronunciation_dictionary_locators.title: Pronunciation Dictionary Locators

voice.description: The name or the ID of the voice to be used for the generation.
voice.title: Voice

version_id.description: The ID of the version of the pronunciation dictionary. If not provided, the latest version will be used.
version_id.title: Version Id

pronunciation_dictionary_id.description: The ID of the pronunciation dictionary.
pronunciation_dictionary_id.title: Pronunciation Dictionary Id

content_type.title: Content Type

url.title: Url

metadata.description: Replace sections of an existing audio with newly generated content

info.title: Queue OpenAPI for sonauto/v2/inpaint
info.description: The OpenAPI schema for the sonauto/v2/inpaint queue.

examples:
[Chorus]
Pigs are soaring in the sky
Wings of bacon flying by
lyrics_prompt.title: Lyrics Prompt
lyrics_prompt.description: The lyrics sung in the generated song. An empty string will generate an instrumental track.

tags.title: Tags
tags.description: Tags/styles of the music to generate. You can view a list of all available tags at https://sonauto.ai/tag-explorer.

prompt_strength.title: Prompt Strength
prompt_strength.description: Controls how strongly your prompt influences the output. Greater values adhere more to the prompt but sound less natural. (This is CFG.)

output_bit_rate.title: Output Bit Rate
output_bit_rate.description: The bit rate to use for mp3 and m4a formats. Not available for other formats.

num_songs.title: Num Songs
num_songs.description: Generating 2 songs costs 1.5x the price of generating 1 song. Also, note that using the same seed may not result in identical songs if the number of songs generated is changed.

sections.title: Sections
sections.description: List of sections to inpaint. Currently, only one section is supported so the list length must be 1.

balance_strength.title: Balance Strength
balance_strength.description: Greater means more natural vocals. Lower means sharper instrumentals. We recommend 0.7.

audio_url.description: The URL of the audio file to alter. Must be a valid publicly accessible URL.
audio_url.title: Audio Url

seed.title: Seed
seed.description: The seed to use for generation. Will pick a random seed if not provided. Repeating a request with identical parameters (must use lyrics and tags, not prompt) and the same seed will generate the same song.

seed.title: Seed
seed.description: The seed used for generation. This can be used to generate an identical song by passing the same parameters with this seed in a future request.

end.title: End
end.description: End time in seconds of the section to inpaint.

start.title: Start
start.description: Start time in seconds of the section to inpaint.

file_size.title: File Size
file_size.description: The size of the file in bytes.

file_name.title: File Name
file_name.description: The name of the file. It will be auto-generated if not provided.

content_type.title: Content Type
content_type.description: The mime type of the file.

url.title: Url
url.description: The URL where the file can be downloaded from.

schema.description: Whether to include logs (`1`) in the response or not (`0`).

success.description: Whether the request was cancelled successfully.

info.description: The OpenAPI schema for the sonauto/v2/text-to-music queue.

prompt.title: Prompt
prompt.description: A description of the track you want to generate. This prompt will be used to automatically generate the tags and lyrics unless you manually set them. For example, if you set prompt and tags, then the prompt will be used to generate only the lyrics.
examples: A pop song about turtles flying

lyrics_prompt.title: Lyrics Prompt
lyrics_prompt.description: The lyrics sung in the generated song. An empty string will generate an instrumental track.

tags.title: Tags
tags.description: Tags/styles of the music to generate. You can view a list of all available tags at https://sonauto.ai/tag-explorer.

prompt_strength.title: Prompt Strength
prompt_strength.description: Controls how strongly your prompt influences the output. Greater values adhere more to the prompt but sound less natural. (This is CFG.)

output_bit_rate.title: Output Bit Rate
output_bit_rate.description: The bit rate to use for mp3 and m4a formats. Not available for other formats.

num_songs.title: Num Songs
num_songs.description: Generating 2 songs costs 1.5x the price of generating 1 song. Also, note that using the same seed may not result in identical songs if the number of songs generated is changed.

bpm.title: Bpm
bpm.description: The beats per minute of the song. This can be set to an integer or the literal string "auto" to pick a suitable bpm based on the tags. Set bpm to null to not condition the model on bpm information.

balance_strength.title: Balance Strength
balance_strength.description: Greater means more natural vocals. Lower means sharper instrumentals. We recommend 0.7.

seed.title: Seed
seed.description: The seed to use for generation. Will pick a random seed if not provided. Repeating a request with identical parameters (must use lyrics and tags, not prompt) and the same seed will generate the same song.

tags.title: Tags
tags.description: The style tags used for generation.

seed.title: Seed
seed.description: The seed used for generation. This can be used to generate an identical song by passing the same parameters with this seed in a future request.

examples.prompt: like revising for an exam I'd have to try and like keep up the momentum because I'd start really early I'd be like okay I'm gonna start revising now and then like you're revising for ages and then I just like start losing steam I didn't do that for the exam we had recently to be fair that was a more of a last minute scenario but like yeah I'm trying to like yeah I noticed this yesterday that like Mondays I sort of start the day with this not like a panic but like a

like a super Mario level. Like it's very like high detail. And like, once you get into the park, it just like, everything looks like a computer game and they have all these, like, you know, if, if there's like a, you know, like in a Mario game, they will have like a question block. And if you like, you know, punch it, a coin will come out. So like everyone, when they come into the park, they get like this little bracelet and then you can go punching question blocks around.

examples:
[00:10.00]Moonlight spills through broken blinds
[00:13.20]Your shadow dances on the dashboard shrine
[00:16.85]Neon ghosts in gasoline rain
[00:20.40]I hear your laughter down the midnight train
[00:24.15]Static whispers through frayed wires
[00:27.65]Guitar strings hum our cathedral choirs
[00:31.30]Flicker screens show reruns of June
[00:34.90]I'm drowning in this mercury lagoon
[00:38.55]Electric veins pulse through concrete skies
[00:42.10]Your name echoes in the hollow where my heartbeat lies
[00:45.75]We're satellites trapped in parallel light
[00:49.25]Burning through the atmosphere of endless night
[01:00.00]Dusty vinyl spins reverse
[01:03.45]Our polaroid timeline bleeds through the verse
[01:07.10]Telescope aimed at dead stars
[01:10.65]Still tracing constellations through prison bars
[01:14.30]Electric veins pulse through concrete skies
[01:17.85]Your name echoes in the hollow where my heartbeat lies
[01:21.50]We're satellites trapped in parallel light
[01:25.05]Burning through the atmosphere of endless night
[02:10.00]Clockwork gears grind moonbeams to rust
[02:13.50]Our fingerprint smudged by interstellar dust
[02:17.15]Velvet thunder rolls through my veins
[02:20.70]Chasing phantom trains through solar plane
[02:24.35]Electric veins pulse through concrete skies
[02:27.90]Your name echoes in the hollow where my heartbeat lies

next_text.description: The text that comes after the text of the current request. Can be used to improve the speech's continuity when concatenating together multiple generations or to influence the speech's continuity in the current generation.
next_text.title: Next Text

speed.title: Speed
speed.description: Speech speed (0.7-1.2). Values below 1.0 slow down the speech, above 1.0 speed it up. Extreme values may affect quality.

examples: Hello! This is a test of the text to speech system, powered by ElevenLabs. How does it sound?

text.title: Text

timestamps.description: Whether to return timestamps for each word in the generated speech
timestamps.title: Timestamps

voice.description: The voice to use for speech generation
voice.title: Voice

language_code.description: Language code (ISO 639-1) used to enforce a language for the model. An error will be returned if language code is not supported by the model.
language_code.title: Language Code

previous_text.description: The text that came before the text of the current request. Can be used to improve the speech's continuity when concatenating together multiple generations or to influence the speech's continuity in the current generation.
previous_text.title: Previous Text

timestamps.description: Timestamps for each word in the generated speech. Only returned if `timestamps` is set to True in the request.

I won't back down
You know you can't deny it now
I won't back down
